description: A systematic and widespread campaign of sexual enslavement that affected hundreds of thousands of women throughout occupied territories. This represents one of the most severe violations of human rights during wartime.

A six-week period of large-scale killing, rape, and arson committed by Japanese military forces against the civilian population. The scale and brutality of the atrocities shocked the international community.
The division of British India led to one of the worst human tragedies of the twentieth century, with violence, displacement, and mass casualties occurring across the subcontinent.
Following India's independence, communal violence erupted in the princely state of Hyderabad, resulting in widespread atrocities and loss of civilian life.
